intro: Psychotria bahiensis var. cornigera, commonly known as the red-eyed Psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its striking red bracts that enclose small, white flowers. It typically grows as an epiphyte or in moist, shaded forest understories. The leaves are usually elliptical with a glossy surface and dark green coloration.
